description: Made some style fixes in the remaining code under chrom/browser/sync and under chrome/test/sync.

messages.text:
Tim,

This patch includes the files I didn't fix in my first pass. The patch contain nit style fixes only.

LGTM++

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1197
File chrome/browser/sync/engine/net/gaia_authenticator.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1197#newcode288
Line 288: unsigned long server_response_code;
nit- init

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1197#newcode338
Line 338: unsigned long server_response_code;
nit- init

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1179
File chrome/browser/sync/notifier/base/async_dns_lookup.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1179#newcode29
Line 29: const int WSAHOST_NOT_FOUND = 11001;  // follows the format in winsock2.h.
capital

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1173
File chrome/browser/sync/notifier/base/string.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1173#newcode169
Line 169: // overflow
periods (here and below)

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1173#newcode202
Line 202: int c = static_cast<int>(*str++);  // current char
caps / periods

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1177
File chrome/browser/sync/notifier/base/string.h (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1177#newcode47
Line 47: //    Convert a string to an int/int64/double.
extra leading spaces

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1177#newcode64
Line 64: //    Convert a string to an int/int64/double.
extra leading spaces (a bunch in this file)

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1118
File chrome/browser/sync/notifier/communicator/mailbox.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1118#newcode46
Line 46: // skip a character in the input and break if we are at the end.
capital

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1135
File chrome/browser/sync/notifier/communicator/single_login_attempt.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1135#newcode157
Line 157: // expect to be deleted at this point.
capital

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1150
File chrome/browser/sync/notifier/gaia_auth/gaiaauth.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1150#newcode32
Line 32: // GaiaAuth is NOT invoked during SASL authenticatioin, but it is invoked even
nit - authentication

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1192
File chrome/browser/sync/syncable/syncable.h (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1192#newcode524
Line 524: // After constructing, you must check good() to test whether the Get succeed.
nit- succeeded

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1192#newcode592
Line 592: // This should always be equal to GetName().sync_name().value(), but maybe
nit- may be

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1217
File chrome/browser/sync/util/highres_timer-linux.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1217#newcode28
Line 28: MICROS_IN_SECOND;
nit- indent

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1204
File chrome/browser/sync/util/user_settings.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1204#newcode90
Line 90: DirectoryManager::GetSyncDataDatabaseFilename())) {
over indented

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1197
File chrome/browser/sync/engine/net/gaia_authenticator.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1197#newcode288
Line 288: unsigned long server_response_code;
On 2009/09/14 17:14:24, timsteele wrote:
> nit- init

Even though I agree this code should be written differently, I prefer leaving it the way it is (and restructure in a different CL) because I prefer making only style changes in this CL.

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1197#newcode338
Line 338: unsigned long server_response_code;
On 2009/09/14 17:14:24, timsteele wrote:
> nit- init

Same as above.

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1179
File chrome/browser/sync/notifier/base/async_dns_lookup.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1179#newcode29
Line 29: const int WSAHOST_NOT_FOUND = 11001;  // follows the format in winsock2.h.
On 2009/09/14 17:14:24, timsteele wrote:
> capital

Done.

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1173
File chrome/browser/sync/notifier/base/string.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1173#newcode169
Line 169: // overflow
On 2009/09/14 17:14:24, timsteele wrote:
> periods (here and below)

Done.

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1173#newcode202
Line 202: int c = static_cast<int>(*str++);  // current char
On 2009/09/14 17:14:24, timsteele wrote:
> caps / periods

Done.

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1177
File chrome/browser/sync/notifier/base/string.h (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1177#newcode47
Line 47: //    Convert a string to an int/int64/double.
On 2009/09/14 17:14:24, timsteele wrote:
> extra leading spaces

Done.

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1177#newcode64
Line 64: //    Convert a string to an int/int64/double.
On 2009/09/14 17:14:24, timsteele wrote:
> extra leading spaces (a bunch in this file)

Done.

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1118
File chrome/browser/sync/notifier/communicator/mailbox.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1118#newcode46
Line 46: // skip a character in the input and break if we are at the end.
On 2009/09/14 17:14:24, timsteele wrote:
> capital

Done.

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1135
File chrome/browser/sync/notifier/communicator/single_login_attempt.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1135#newcode157
Line 157: // expect to be deleted at this point.
On 2009/09/14 17:14:24, timsteele wrote:
> capital

Done.

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1150
File chrome/browser/sync/notifier/gaia_auth/gaiaauth.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1150#newcode32
Line 32: // GaiaAuth is NOT invoked during SASL authenticatioin, but it is invoked even
On 2009/09/14 17:14:24, timsteele wrote:
> nit - authentication

Done.

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1192
File chrome/browser/sync/syncable/syncable.h (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1192#newcode524
Line 524: // After constructing, you must check good() to test whether the Get succeed.
On 2009/09/14 17:14:24, timsteele wrote:
> nit- succeeded

Done.

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1192#newcode592
Line 592: // This should always be equal to GetName().sync_name().value(), but maybe
On 2009/09/14 17:14:24, timsteele wrote:
> nit- may be

Done.

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1217
File chrome/browser/sync/util/highres_timer-linux.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1217#newcode28
Line 28: MICROS_IN_SECOND;
On 2009/09/14 17:14:24, timsteele wrote:
> nit- indent

Done.

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1204
File chrome/browser/sync/util/user_settings.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/203043/diff/1110/1204#newcode90
Line 90: DirectoryManager::GetSyncDataDatabaseFilename())) {
On 2009/09/14 17:14:24, timsteele wrote:
> over indented

Done.

subject: Made some style fixes in the remaining code under chrom/browser/sync and unde...
